text:
Hi guys! I'm Laura Vitale, and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to show you

how to make the ultimate delicious ice cream
sandwich.

Now, I don't particularly think you need a
specific recipe to make an ice cream sandwich

because it's just ice cream and some cookies
but this is the most amazing delicious combination.

The things you're going to need for it are
some cookies, and these are my giant chocolate

white chocolate chip cookies that I've made
in another episode, so check that out if you

haven't, and then for the ice cream, I'm using
fudge ripple ice cream. This is my favorite
combination.

We've got the ice cream, mini chocolate chips,
chopped-up walnuts, and toffee bits to roll

these in. It's like, it's just mind-blowing!
Okay, I'm so excited! You put ice cream in
front of me and I'm so excited.

So, in here I've got the fudge ripple ice
cream which is sweet, it's got fudge, it's

got vanilla, it's just wonderful. I'm going
to add in my mini chocolate chips and walnuts

and very quickly I'm just going to stir all
these together. Then you work really, really

quickly. You scoop your ice cream in between
(look at that, I'm going to do a couple scoops

for an ice sandwich "what the heck, I'm not
driving". Tell me where that's from. I want

YOU guys to tell me what movie is that phrase
from?. You sandwich it, and then you kind

of dip it into the toffee bits, you want to
work quickly because this is going to melt!

Then put them back on your baking sheet and
put them into the freezer. And I'll show what

they look like once they have firmed up a
bit.

Look at that baby! Man, that is just too good.
I'm telling you, it's the combination. Ah!

Go to www.LauraInTheKitchen.com to find out
the amounts of everything, not that you really
need a recipe for it.

I hope you enjoyed spending time with me.
I'll see you next time. Bye!
